intro: Kuepferella, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have upright, herbaceous stems and alternate, palmately lobed leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color. Kuepferella species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
